intro: Phyllanthus pacificus var. quaylei, commonly known as the Hawaiian phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has a short stem with opposite leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. This variety is notable for its limited distribution and is considered a rare endemic species within its native range.
